channel.title: Whats this error mean?
channel.description:
whats this error mean?? :o
[client-1-Ashley]: Loading finished. [client-1-Ashley]: playerCommand: banuser k java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\Documents and Settings\Jordan.pimp\My Documents\my server stuff\admi .txt (The system cannot find the path specified) at java.io.FileOutputStream.openAppend(Native Method) at java.io.FileOutputStream.(FileOutputStream.java:177) at java.io.FileOutputStream.(FileOutputStream.java:102) at java.io.FileWriter.(FileWriter.java:61) at client.customCommand(client.java:13055) at client.parseIncomingPackets(client.java:23709) at client.packetProcess(client.java:19047) at client.packetSending(client.java:19000) at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:153)

item.title: Whats this error mean?
item.dc:creator: @Xile_Maizez Xile Maizez
item.description:
@Xile_Maizez wrote:

(The system cannot find the path specified)

I’ve got this before, you have to go to the command “banuser”
And re-direct the “C:\Documents XXXXXXXX” To where you file of bans actually is.

So open client.java

search for

"banuser"

Under that you should see

C:\Documents and Settings\Jordan.pimp\My Documents\my server stuff\admi .txt

Change it to wherever your actually banlog is at.

Example:

C:\Documents and Settings\Users\User\MyClient\data\bandusers.txt

Dont use that code, use something similar to it, just keep editing it until you end up at the .txt file where your ban logs is at.
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 03, 2008, 10:03:44 am[/size][hr]Wow lol, 'Rich pretty much explained it in 1 sentance, and i typed like an enite Tut haha.

Read full topic

item.title: Whats this error mean?
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

You need to edit the directory of where it logs the player you banned in your ‘banuser’ command.

Read full topic
